comment.body:
This class provides services needed to instrument Java programming language code. Instrumentation is the addition of byte-codes to methods for the purpose of gathering data to be utilized by tools. Since the changes are purely additive, these tools do not modify application state or behavior. Examples of such benign tools include monitoring agents, profilers, coverage analyzers, and event loggers.

The only way to access an instance of the Instrumentation interface is for the JVM to be launched in a way that indicates the agent class - see {@linkplain java.lang.instrument the package specification}. The Instrumentation instance is passed to the premain method of the agent class. Once an agent acquires the Instrumentation instance, the agent may call methods on the instance at any time. @since JDK1.5
